docs.abstract: The attorney general, reopening the conversation on security vs. privacy, said that encryption and other measures effectively turned devices into “law-free zones.”
docs.snippet: The attorney general, reopening the conversation on security vs. privacy, said that encryption and other measures effectively turned devices into “law-free zones.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Attorney General William P. Barr said on Tuesday that technology companies should stop using advanced encryption and other security measures that effectively turn devices into “law-free zones” that keep out law enforcement officials conducting criminal investigations.

headline.main: Barr Revives Encryption Debate, Calling on Tech Firms to Allow for Law Enforcement
headline.print_headline: Barr Wants Tech Companies To Stop Blocking Out Police

docs.abstract: Apple rolled out ambitious updates to its apps and smartwatch at its annual developer conference.
docs.snippet: Apple rolled out ambitious updates to its apps and smartwatch at its annual developer conference.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Calif. — In the history of Apple software, few services have been as important and influential as iTunes. It upended the music industry and popularized a new way to buy music, allowing people to purchase songs for a dollar.

headline.main: Apple’s WWDC Highlights: the Death of iTunes and $6,000 Macs
headline.print_headline: Apple Beefs Up Its Safeguards And Its Desktop

byline.original: By Brian X. Chen and Jack Nicas

docs.abstract: Despairing about privacy isn’t an admission of defeat. It’s an acknowledgment that taking control of our data matters.
docs.snippet: Despairing about privacy isn’t an admission of defeat. It’s an acknowledgment that taking control of our data matters.
docs.lead_paragraph: This article is part of a limited-run newsletter. You can sign up here.

docs.abstract: Amazon says it’s not responsible if its creations are abused.
docs.snippet: Amazon says it’s not responsible if its creations are abused.
docs.lead_paragraph: Don’t bring a knife to a chaos factory.

headline.main: ‘If You’ve Built a Chaos Factory, You Can’t Dodge Responsibility for the Chaos’

docs.abstract: The social media giant thinks privacy is a you problem.

docs.lead_paragraph: This article is part of a limited-run newsletter. You can sign up here.

headline.main: Facebook Under Oath: You Have No Expectation of Privacy

docs.abstract: The executive played a key role in the iPod and iPhone during his 27 years at Apple, which will be a client of his new company.
docs.snippet: The executive played a key role in the iPod and iPhone during his 27 years at Apple, which will be a client of his new company.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Jony Ive, Apple’s chief design officer and one of the most influential executives in the history of the Silicon Valley giant, is leaving the company.

headline.main: Jony Ive, Designer Who Made Apple Look Like Apple, Is Leaving to Start a Firm
headline.print_headline: Designer Who Made Apple Look Like Apple Is Leaving

docs.abstract: Works by Nick Cave, Nathalie Djurberg, John Giorno and others have been choreographed into the landscape for an Apple-New Museum walking tour.
docs.snippet: Works by Nick Cave, Nathalie Djurberg, John Giorno and others have been choreographed into the landscape for an Apple-New Museum walking tour.
docs.lead_paragraph: Words appeared in the sky, the color of clouds, and then faded into a jumble of letters in the background. It was an ephemeral poem, with lines like “Catch the falling knife” visible for a few seconds through the portal of an iPhone pointed at the skyline above Central Park.

headline.main: Apple Transforms Central Park Into an Augmented Reality Gallery
headline.print_headline: iPhone Art Program In Central Park

docs.abstract: America goes after Huawei, and Chinese consumers rally to buy from the company.
docs.snippet: America goes after Huawei, and Chinese consumers rally to buy from the company.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Earlier this week the Chinese government aggressively devalued its currency — the clearest sign yet that it is hunkering down for a protracted fight with the United States over trade.

headline.main: Trump Has Succeeded. Now Lots of Chinese People Are Buying Huawei Phones.

docs.abstract: While Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google have all drawn attention to how they dominate markets, the reasons are as different as the companies.
docs.snippet: While Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google have all drawn attention to how they dominate markets, the reasons are as different as the companies.
docs.lead_paragraph: Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google have been the envy of corporate America, admired for their size, influence and remarkable growth.

headline.main: How Each Big Tech Company May Be Targeted by Regulators

byline.original: By Jack Nicas, Karen Weise and Mike Isaac

docs.abstract: Investigations could eventually lead to the breakup of some companies, and to new laws that might alter the balance of corporate power.
docs.snippet: Investigations could eventually lead to the breakup of some companies, and to new laws that might alter the balance of corporate power.
docs.lead_paragraph: Investigations could eventually lead to the breakup of some companies, and to new laws that might alter the balance of corporate power.
